derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English cressant, from Old French creissant, from Latin crescere 'grow'. The spelling change in the 17th century was due to the influence of the Latin

entry.tran: 新月形，月牙形(伊斯兰教最重要的象征)
entry.def: A  crescent is a curved shape that is wider in the middle than at its ends, like the shape of the moon during its first and last quarters. It is the most important symbol of the Islamic faith.

example.ex: A glittering Islamic crescent tops the mosque.
example.tran: 新月形标志在清真寺顶端闪闪发光。

entry.tran: (常用于街道或一排房子的名称中)新月形街区
entry.def: Crescent is sometimes used as part of the name of a street or row of houses that is usually built in a curve.

means.word_mean: 1. any shape resembling the curved shape of the moon in its first or last quarters
1. resembling the new moon in shape

jushi.english: The crescent moon had climbed high in the sky before she sent the others home.
